data.title: Adequate
data.text: I ordered in while staying at a nearby hotel. I got the pizza fries and beef/lamb gyro. The ordering system is through mypizza.com, which has a user-friendly interface. I requested no onions on the gyro, and was happy to see that they complied with my request. I'm not used to feta on my gyro and there was quite a lot.  I scraped some off and it was tasty. The pizza fries were also good; I got a small order which was a good amount. The prices were very reasonable.

data.title: Awesome food.
data.text: Never dissapointed with the quality of food. this place is amazing. Will never eat any other subs from any where else. The salads are bomb.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: We have ordered from them twice back to back. We tried the Super Subs . Don't have any words for the subs. Just plain OMG. The salads are amazing. The wings are great also. But the super subs are just -Who would come up with something like this. This is a place that will make you not want to order subs from any other place. Best yet .

data.title: Nice Pizza Spot
data.text: I love when I get a chance to stop by and get pizza from here. The pizza is so good especially the Buffalo Ranch. The pizzas are made fresh. The prices are very reasonable. The workers are very friendly.

data.title: Great for late night delivery (before 1am)
data.text: I ordered from them while staying at the nearby Hilton because I arrived after 10pm.  I ordered a salad with grilled chicken, some fries, and a drink. They told me 40 minutes.  The food showed up in about 25 minutes and I had to take the elevator down to get the food.  The salad was great and came with ranch dressing.  The fries were huge - I ordered a large fry and I think the fries could have fed a family of four.  They were crinkle cut and reasonably good but not outstanding.  I was looking for options that were more or less gluten free which can be hard at a pizza place.  But marvin has an extensive menu with these other items so I was good to go ordering from them.

data.title: Hands down, best pizzeria in DC
data.text: I've been a customer for 25+ years. Unfortunately, I don't live in the area anymore, and I miss it terribly, but anytime I am in the area, I make it a point to stop by. The greatest cheesesteaks ever, anywhere, period. Years ago, I lived in Philly for 2 years. I was excited when I first moved there because I thought there would be a better cheesesteak than Starvin' Marvin. I was wrong. There is no better. The Reuben is the best I've ever had as well, better than Woodside Deli, better than Parkway Deli, better than many spots I've tried from Florida to New York. For years it was off the menu, and I begged them to bring it back. Now that they have, I don't live there anymore, but it's still outstanding. If they came out with fried chicken, I might be compelled to move back!

data.title: Nothing Great
data.text:
I had the Starvin Marvin Special and it was nothing special. It was average at best. For the price I was expecting more cheese and more toppings. Every time when I travel I try to stay away from the National Pizza places and try local places. I would say this place was in line with the National places with a higher price.

I would not return!

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: I have been searching for some ny style pizza in appearance and taste for 6 months since I've moved to this area. I had reached the point of begging family members to bring it with them when they visited. I was very skeptical going in here as it is a hole in the wall but the pizza was very good and we were pleasantly surprised. The cheesesteak was good too. The fries not so much. But the pizza was actually very good. Finally found a good pizza spot in maryland. Thank God!!!
